reviews.text: Great location in the middle of Olde Town. Very small rooms, however. But Eurpoean feel and beautiful views from the breakfast room. Lovely filling breakfast each morning provided. Delicious coffee. If you don't mind the small room and even smaller bathroom, you will like this historic small hotel. I think I read it is the oldest hotel in Zurich, but no worries - modern and updated. 10 minute walk to Main Zurich train station with trains to anywhere in Europe.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.text: I have just returned from a trip to Switzerland during which I spent two nights at this hotel. The staff were very helpful, the breakfast generous and the location very central. No air-conditioning, however a fan was provided. The hotel has a rooftop terrace and a wine cellar (neither of which I used - I was too busy doing as much sightseeing in the time I had!) Would certaainly stay there again.
reviews.title: Pleasant, centrally located hotel

likes.liked: — Central location near sights and restaurants.
likes.disliked: — The room didn't have air-conditioning and the fan was noisy at night.

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hirschen Hotel with my wife for three nights while on business in Zurich.
reviews.title: Decent, friendly, would go there again

reviews.text: This is old, central and very cool. Most amazing it has an elevator that goes down (from every floor) to the wine cellar! It's in the center of the Alt Stadt, has a great breakfast, wonderful, helpful staff. And is surrounded by all sorts of places to eat. TIP. In Summer, ask for a room at the back. The square outside, while great to look at, stays noisy until at least 3a.m.
reviews.title: TAKE THE ELEVATOR!.. to the CELLAR

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I traveled to Zurich for New Year's, and after looking at a lot of different hotels, prices, availability, I finally (and somewhat reluctantly, because 'Yes, it is a little pricey") decided to book with Hirschen. They were extremely prompt and professional in their correspondence, and despite the cost, that's just the price of things in Zurich. The hotel was very easy to find, 10min by foot from the train station, in a pedestrian area just off of the main street by the river. The area was a great point to get anywhere in the city (by foot), including all of the shopping, pubs, restaurants and everything else that was happening during NYE. Breakfast was enjoyable, free wi-fi is always a bonus. The staff were FANTASTIC.
reviews.title: Stay here!

reviews.text: Yes, the rooms weren't so big, but that's not so unusual for Europe. All in all, it was a great stay (to the point that I created this tripadvisor account just so I could put a review up), and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice Location, but small rooms, and a little overpriced

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hirschen for 2 nights on a business trip. The hotel is located near the East Bank of the river and only a ten minute walk from the Zurich Central Rail station.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very historic and quaint. However the rooms are tiny and there was really no-where in the room to have a proper desk (just a small round table with 2 chairs). The bed was comfortable. The bathroom is also tiny and the shower is physically quite hard to turn-around in (it’s that small!).
reviews.title: Not bad not great a bit overpriced.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hirschen for two nights in July. Like all Swiss hotels, it's quite expensive. Its location is great, right in the old center of Zurich; 8-10 walk from the train station. The room was smaller than hotels in other Swiss cities (this is a VERY old building, though with modern fixtures/everything), but it was clean and comfortable. Breakfast buffet was average. Staff was very helpful, very friendly (e.g. willing to make reservations etc.). For the same money in almost any other country, of course, you'd have a much better hotel, and in Luzern and Lauterbrunnen, for about the same price, we had much nicer hotels. Still, the Hirschen has merit. Elevator, too.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Very nice hotel in the middle of Niederdorf. It is also very close to the trainstation.
reviews.title: Excellent to stay in the city
